data.title: PennantPark prices $200 million 6.75% notes due 2029
data.description:
• PennantPark Floating Rate Capital (PFLT) said on Thursday it priced an underwritten public offering of $200 million aggregate principal amount of 6.75% notes due 2029.
  • The notes will mature on March 4, 2029 and may be redeemed at the company’s option at par plus a make-whole premium, if applicable, and at par starting three months prior to maturity.
  • The offering is expected to close on or about March 4, 2026, subject to customary conditions.
  • The company said it intends to use the net proceeds to repay outstanding obligations under its revolving credit facility, invest in new or existing portfolio companies, and for general corporate or strategic purposes.
  • PFLT -0.47% premarket to $8.4.
  • Source: Press Release

data.title: Palmer Square Capital BDC GAAP EPS of $1.66
data.description:
• Palmer Square Capital BDC press release (PSBD): Q4 GAAP EPS of $1.66.
  • Total investment income of $29.8 million for the fourth quarter of 2025, compared to $34.9 million for the prior year period
  • Net investment income of $13.1 million or $0.41 per share for the fourth quarter of 2025, as compared to $14.8 million or $0.45 per share for the comparable period last year
  • Net asset value of $14.85 per share as of December 31, 2025, compared to $15.39 per share as of September 30, 2025
  • Total net realized and unrealized losses of $18.4 million for the fourth quarter of 2025, compared to losses of $2.9 million in the fourth quarter of 2024
  • As of December 31, 2025, total assets were $1.2 billion and total net assets were $464.1 million
  • Debt-to-equity as of December 31, 2025 was 1.54x, compared to 1.53x as of September 30, 2025
  • Paid cash distributions to stockholders totaling $0.43 per share for the fourth quarter of 2025
  • Declared a first quarter regular base dividend distribution of $0.36 per share, payable on April 9, 2026, to shareholders of record as of March 27, 2026. In accordance with our dividend policy, we expect to announce a supplemental dividend in March
  •

data.title: C3.ai crashes as Wall Street gets the ick following guidance shortfall, mass layoffs
data.description:
C3.ai (AI) shares crashed more than 23% in premarket trading on Thursday after the company announced mass layoffs and badly missed Wall Street's estimates, leaving analysts to sharply criticize the enterprise software maker.

Citizens analyst Patrick Walravens downgraded C3.ai to Market Perform from Market Outperform, noting that the layoffs show new CEO Stephen Ehikian is “taking concrete steps to turn the business around,” but there are several long-standing issues.

“[We] are stepping to the sidelines for the time being for several reasons including: 1) the near-term new business challenges; 2) the risks associated with the business turnaround; 3) the loss of the day-to-day involvement of founder and former CEO Thomas M. Siebel, who disclosed in 2025 that he had been diagnosed with an autoimmune disease that caused significant visual impairment; 4) the market shift toward horizontal GenAI platforms; and 5) intensifying competition from vendors like Snowflake (Cortex), Databricks (Mosaic), Salesforce (Agentforce), Microsoft (Copilot), and Palantir,” Walravens wrote in a note to clients.

KeyBanc Capital Markets analyst Eric Heath cut his price target on C3.ai to $6 from $10 and said he does not expect much in the way of a turnaround in the health of the business.

“Reiterate underweight following a significant F3Q miss and guide below due to sales misexecution,” Heath wrote in a note to clients. “F3Q revenue missed by 30% and F4Q revenue guided below by 36%. In response, [management] instituted a $135M cost restructuring plan, including a 26% workforce reduction. While a positive to address the cost structure of the business, visibility into revenue stabilization is low and we meaningfully lower estimates and continue to project large losses through our forecast period.”

data.title: Baron India Fund adds Le Travenues Technology; exits Godrej Consumer Products, Jio Financial Services among Q4 moves
data.description:
Baron India Fund appreciated 0.42% (institutional shares) during the final quarter of 2025, while its relevant benchmark, the MSCI AC Asia ex Japan/India Linked Index (the Linked Benchmark), rose 4.78%.

The fund, in its Q4 shareholder letter, said that Bharti Airtel, Precision Wires India, and Reliance Industries were top contributors, while Kaynes Technology India, Eternal, and InterGlobal Aviation were top detractors for the fourth quarter.

During the quarter, the fund initiated a position in Le Travenues Technology (Ixigo), India’s second-largest online travel agency, with about 10% to 15% share of total gross transaction value. 

The fund also strengthened its positions in HDFC Bank (HDB), Reliance Industries, GMR Power and Urban Infra, Precision Wires India, Bajaj Finserv, Kirloskar Oil Engines, and Eternal.

According to the shareholder letter, the fund exited positions in Godrej Consumer Products, SRF Limited, Jio Financial Services, and Tips Music due to uncertainties over the durability of earnings growth and/or competitive positioning going forward.

Source: Q4 shareholder letter

data.title: Berkshire’s PacifiCorp owes another $305M in latest Oregon wildfire verdict
data.description:
An Oregon jury awarded $305M Wednesday to 16 wildfire survivors harmed by the Santiam Canyon wildfire in 2020, in the 15th damages trial since a 2023 verdict that found Berkshire Hathaway's (BRK.A) (BRK.B) PacifiCorp utility was grossly negligent in the state's 2020 Labor Day fires.

The jury verdict form showed 12 adults in the latest trial were each awarded $18.5M in non-economic damages for pain and suffering, while four minors were each awarded $5M.

Five people died in the Santiam Canyon fire, and more than 400K acres burned across four counties.

The verdict was the largest issued in relation to the James v. PacifiCorp class action lawsuit, pushing PacifiCorp's total liability past $1B.

Last week, PacifiCorp agreed to pay the federal government $575M over public lands that burned in Oregon and California.

data.title: Banco Macro reports Q4 results
data.description:
• Banco Macro press release (BMA): Q4 THE BANK'S NET INCOME totaled Ps.100.1 billion in 4Q25 (Ps.290.7 billion in FY2025) recovering from the loss posted in the previous quarter. This result was 26% or Ps.34.4 billion lower than the result posted in 4Q24.
  • In 4Q25, OPERATING INCOME (before G&A and personnel expenses) totaled Ps.1.17 trillion, 39% or Ps.324.2 billion higher than in 3Q25 and 9% or Ps.94.4 trillion higher than the same period of last year.
  • In 4Q25, OPERATING INCOME (after G&A and personnel expenses) totaled Ps.453.2 billion, 156% or Ps.275.9 billion higher than in 3Q25 and 4% or Ps.20.3 billion lower than the same period of last year.
  • In 4Q25, BANCO MACRO'S TOTAL FINANCING decreased 2% or Ps.210.6 billion quarter over quarter ("QoQ") totaling Ps.10.71 trillion and increased 40% or Ps.3.08 trillion year over year ("YoY"). In 4Q25 peso financing increased 2% while USD financing decreased 20%.
  • In 4Q25, BANCO MACRO'S TOTAL DEPOSITS increased 8% or Ps.958.1 billion QoQ and increased 24% or Ps.2.61 trillion YoY, totaling Ps.13.69 trillion and representing 76% of the Bank's total liabilities. Private sector deposits increased 11% or Ps.1.27 trillion QoQ. In 4Q25, Peso deposits increased 3% while USD deposits increased 10%.
  •

data.title: TORM GAAP EPS of $0.87
data.description:
• TORM press release (TRMD): FY GAAP EPS of $0.87.

  • In 2025, TORM generated time charter equivalent earnings (TCE) of USD 910m (2024: USD 1,135m). Adjusted EBITDA for the Group totaled USD 578m including unrealized losses on financial instruments of USD 7m (2024: USD 844m including unrealized gains on financial instruments of USD 7m) and a net profit for the year of USD 286m (2024: USD 612m).

data.title: ElevenLabs to use Google Cloud services powered by Nvidia chips
data.description:
AI voice startup ElevenLabs and Alphabet's (GOOG) (GOOGL) Google Cloud announced a multi-year extension of their collaboration to make AI voice tools more accessible to businesses globally.

ElevenLabs will use Google Cloud's G4 virtual machines, or VMs, powered by Nvidia's (NVDA) RTX PRO 6000 Blackwell Graphics Processing Units, or GPUs, to train and serve its voice models. 

The companies said that ElevenLabs is also integrating Google's Gemini AI models directly into its Agents Platform to unlock reasoning and multi-step planning for its voice assistants.

The startup is also incorporating Google's Veo model into its Creative Platform, enabling teams to produce multimedia content — including video and audio — in less time, according to the companies.

The new agreement provides access to a significantly larger cluster of Nvidia's Blackwell GPUs, enabling ElevenLabs to reliably support even larger deployments for enterprise customers and ensure its research teams have access to highly optimized AI compute.

Under the collaboration, ElevenLabs has also launched its solutions on Google Cloud Marketplace, allowing customers to scale conversational agents for customer support, internal training, and inbound sales. 

"Now with G4 VMs powered by NVIDIA Blackwell, we're pushing our multimodal models even further—faster inference, better reliability, instant replies across languages," said ElevenLabs's Co-Founder Mati Staniszewski.

Earlier this month, ElevenLabs raised $500M in a Series D funding round led by Sequoia Capital, valuing the company at $11B.

data.title: Birchtech prices $15 million public offering, shares to debut on NYSE American
data.description:
• Birchtech (BCHT) said on Thursday it priced an underwritten public offering of 6.25 million shares of common stock at $2.40 per share, for gross proceeds of about $15 million.
  • The company granted underwriters a 30-day option to purchase up to an additional 937,500 shares to cover over allotments.

  • Birchtech said its shares were approved for listing on the NYSE American and are expected to begin trading on February 26 under the symbol “BCHT.”

  • Trading on the OTCQB market operated by OTC Markets Group Inc. will terminate upon the start of NYSE American trading. The stock will remain listed on the Toronto Stock Exchange.

  • The offering is expected to close on or about February 27, subject to customary conditions.
  • BCHTD closed +4.07% at $2.81.
  • Source: Press Release

data.title: Soleno Therapeutics appoints Jennifer Fulk as CFO
data.description:
• Soleno Therapeutics (SLNO) announced on Thursday the appointment of Jennifer Fulk as chief financial officer, succeeding James Mackaness, who announced that he will be retiring from the company by the end of the first quarter.
  • The firm said that Mackaness will serve as a consultant to Soleno through the end of the year to ensure a smooth transition.
  • Soleno Therapeutics added that Fulk brings to Soleno more than two decades of public company experience in leading financial strategy, investor relations, financial reporting, and operational efficiency, with a diverse career progression that includes 15 years at Eli Lilly.
  • SLNO +1.19% premarket to $41.5.
  • Source: Press Release
